result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody J. Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--no contact with Jennifer Muckleroy excepted limited contact as authorized by the Agent; Ms. Muckleroy may have contact with Cody Alexander while he is incarcerated through letters or phone or personal contact;   any contact is to be of a positive nature, so control of this is needed by the Agent

--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--no consumption of alcohol or any non-prescribed medications without approval of the Agent 
--no acts or threats of violence
--to obtain and maintain employment and/or an educational program as directed by the Agent 
--if eligible for CSP (Community Support Program), to follow through with services under that program 
--if believed to be eligible for Social Security Disability, to follow through with that application process
--to undergo an evaluation to address the concerns identified in the Compass Assessment

Arresting Agency: FAPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

**Per 5/11/18 Court order Amendment to Judgment of Conviction : Mr. Alexander may reside with his mother, Jennifer Muckelroy, if she allows him to do so, and if she agrees to comply with the "strict set of rules" and ensures Cody does so as well. She or Agent may revoke that privilege at any point. Cody Alexander must comply with the "strict set of rules" referenced in Agent Meyers 4/23/18 letter to the court.**

[MK] cases #14CF211 & #14CF227 called at 10:13am. 
Defendant Cody J. Alexander in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance as to Case #14CF211.
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Teuber, by Attorney Svehlek.

In case #14CF211, on Count #2:  the Court sentences Mr. Alexander to 8 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 5 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.
The Court finds that Mr. Alexander is statutorily eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Alexander is statutorily eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 196 days credit for time already served (consisting of 32 days pre-sentence credit; 8 days for a hold from 4/27/15 to 5/5/15;  43 days for a hold from 5/5/15 to 6/17/15,  and 113 days from 8/13/15 to 12/4/15).
The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no contact with Jennifer Muckleroy excepted limited contact as authorized by the Agent; Ms. Muckleroy may have contact with Cody Alexander while he is incarcerated through letters or phone or personal contact;  any contact is to be of a positive nature, so control of this is needed by the Agent 
--Mr. Alexander is not to reside with his mother 
--to pay all outstanding balances due on court ordered costs and fees
--to undergo any mental health assessments as deemed appropriate by the Agent and by Mr. Alexander's therapists
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--no consumption of alcohol or any non-prescribed medications without approval of the Agent 
--no acts or threats of violence
--to obtain and maintain employment and/or an educational program as directed by the Agent 
--if eligible for CSP (Community Support Program), to follow through with services under that program 
--if believed to be eligible for Social Security Disability, to follow through with that application process
--to undergo an evaluation to address the concerns identified in the Compass Assessment 
--to pay balance due on restitution of $47.97 payable to Shopko of Fort Atkinson WI 
--to pay balance due on restitution of $8.16, payable to Pick 'N Save of Fort Atkinson WI
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee

In Case #14CF211, on Count #6: 
--the Court sentences Mr. Alexander to serve 30 days in Jail, concurrent. 
  
In Case #14CF211, on Count #10: 
--the Court sentences Mr. Alexander to serve 30 days in Jail, concurrent 

In Case #14CF227, on Count #1: the Court sentences Mr. Alexander to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, current with Case #14CF211.
The Court finds that Mr. Alexander is statutorily eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Alexander is statutorily eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Days credit for time already served: 122 days (consisting of 8 days pre-sentence credit, and the dates of a hold from 4/27/15 to  5/5/15, and for 8/13/15 to 12/4/15)
The Court orders as Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
--no contact with Jennifer Muckleroy excepted limited contact as authorized by the Agent; Ms. Muckleroy may have contact with Cody Alexander while he is incarcerated through letters or phone or personal contact;   any contact is to be of a positive nature, so control of this is needed by the Agent 
--Mr. Alexander is not to reside with his mother 
--to pay all outstanding balances due on court ordered costs and fees
--to undergo any mental Health assessments deemed appropriate by the Agent and by Mr. Alexander's therapists
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--no consumption of alcohol or any non-prescribed medications without approval of the Agent 
--no acts or threats of violence
--to obtain andmaintain employment and/or an educational program as directed by the Agent 
--if eligible for CSP (Community Support Program), to follow through with services under that program 
--if believed to be eligible for Social Security Disability, to follow through with that application process
--to undergo an evaluation to address the concerns identified in the Compass Assessment

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
Defendant Cody J. Alexander in court with attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Cases 14CF211, 14CF227, 14CF237, 14CM165 & 14CM233 called together at 10:40 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Cody J. Alexander in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF211 & 14CF227:Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Alexander waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information
; Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1-14CM233, Count #1-14CM165, Count #2, #6 & #10-14CF211 and Count #1-14CF227; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2-14CM233, Counts #3, #4, #5, #6, #7, #8, #9 & #11-14CF211, Count #2-14CF227 and case 14CF237
Sentencing arguments by ADA Hall; Statement by Jennifer Muckleroy; Sentencing Arguments by Atty Svehlek

On Count #1-14CM233, Count #1-14CM165, Count #2, #6 & #10-14CF211 and Count #1-14CF227, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail (on Ct#2-14CF211), with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith
--Mental Health Evaluation and follow-through with all recommended treatment
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment 
--Participate in educational program if recommended by Agent
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--May reside with Jennifer Muckleroy if she allows him to do so, she or Agent may revoke that privilege at any point in time
--To pay restitution of $47.97 payable to Fort Atkinson Shopko
--To pay restitution of $8.16, payable to Fort Atkinson Pick-n-Save
--To pay costs of $243 (14CM233)
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge (14CM233)
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge (14CM233)
--To pay costs of $243 (14CM165)
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge (14CM165)
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge (14CM165)
--To pay costs of $268 (14CF227)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (14CF227)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (14CF227)
--To pay costs of $754 (14CF211-$268-Ct#1, $243-Cts 6 & 10)
--To pay $650 DNA Surcharge (14CF211- $250-Ct#1, $200-Cts 6 & 10)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (14CF211)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee

Court presents concerns and indicates that those concerns may be addressed through Anger Management, but does not specifically order this *note on JOC*
Court orders that all costs/fees still owing at the end of probation be reduced to civil judgment rather than extend probation

Days credit for time already served: 2 days - 14CM165
Days credit for time already served: 0 days - 14CM233
Days credit for time already served: 32 days - 14CF211 - Ct#2
Days credit for time already served: 1 day - 14CF227

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court presents basis and grants expungement on 14CF211 & 14CF227, upon successful completion of probation and if during the course of his probation he commits no new crimes. Petition must be submitted, upon completion of probation.

TO COVER CASES 14CF227 & 14CM233

Cases 14CF227 & 14CM233 called together at 2:02 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Cody J. Alexander appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Alexander is eligible for SPD Services
14CF227 & 14CM233: Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; charges & penalties recited; reading waived
14CF227 & 14CM233: Court finds probable cause within the complaints to support charges

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, to cover both cases, with conditions:
-No acts or threats of violence 
-Not commit any acts of damage to anyone's property including that of Jennifer L. Muckleroy
-To take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-No presence within the City Limits of Fort Atkinson, WI

14CF227: Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties; Count #2 to track with felony - no plea taken 
14CM233: Pleas of Not Guilty entered; Speedy Trial waived by Defendant

NEXT: BOTH CASES (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 7/23/14 at 10:20 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 8/5/14 at 9:30 am - Send notices (along with case 14CF211)
